io.gearpump.streaming.appmaster

Interface TaskScheduler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TaskSchedulerImpl

    public interface TaskScheduler
    This schedules tasks to run for new allocated resources.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  TaskScheduler.Location 
      static class  TaskScheduler.Location$ 
      static class  TaskScheduler.TaskStatus 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      io.gearpump.cluster.scheduler.ResourceRequest[] executorFailed(int executorId)
      This notify the scheduler that {executorId} is failed, and expect a set of ResourceRequest for all failed tasks on that executor.
      io.gearpump.cluster.scheduler.ResourceRequest[] getResourceRequests()
      Get the resource requirements for all unscheduled tasks.
      scala.collection.immutable.List<TaskId> schedule(int workerId, int executorId, io.gearpump.cluster.scheduler.Resource resource)
      This notify the scheduler that a resource slot on {workerId} and {executorId} is allocated, and expect a task to be scheduled in return.
      void setDAG(DAG dag)
      This notify the scheduler that the task DAG is created.

        io.gearpump.cluster.scheduler.ResourceRequest[] getResourceRequests()

      • schedule

        scala.collection.immutable.List<TaskId> schedule(int workerId,
                                                 int executorId,
                                                 io.gearpump.cluster.scheduler.Resource resource)
        This notify the scheduler that a resource slot on {workerId} and {executorId} is allocated, and expect a task to be scheduled in return. Task locality should be considered when deciding whether to offer a task on target {worker} and {executor}

        Parameters:
        workerId - which worker this resource is located.
        executorId - which executorId this resource belongs to.
        resource - (undocumented)
        Returns:
        a list of tasks

      • executorFailed

        io.gearpump.cluster.scheduler.ResourceRequest[] executorFailed(int executorId)
        This notify the scheduler that {executorId} is failed, and expect a set of ResourceRequest for all failed tasks on that executor.

        Parameters:
        executorId - executor that failed
        Returns:
        resource requests of the failed executor
